conversation.text: Hi! What can I help you?
I want to roast jalapenos on the grill.
You need a gas or charcoal grill. Which one do you want to use?
evidence: Prepare a gas or charcoal grill

conversation.text: Gas grill.
Heat the gas grill to medium-high.
evidence: Turn a gas grill on to medium-high.

conversation.text: What's next?
Then clean jalapenos with water.
evidence: Rinse any dirt off of the jalapeños

conversation.text: Have cleaned them.
Next, place jalapenos on the preheated grill, allowing about 1 inch between them. Then pud the lid on the grill.
evidence: Arrange the jalapeños on the hot grill
there's a little space (about 1 inch or 2/5 cm) between them
Put the lid on the grill.

conversation.text: They are arranged on the grill now.
Then roast jalapenos for 5 minutes with the lid on.
evidence: Roast the jalapeños on the grill for 5 minutes
Roast the jalapeños on the grill for 5 minutes

conversation.text: Why with the lid on?
With the lid on, the interior of your food can be cooked through.
I see. What's next?
Since you have roasted one side, you need to turn jalapenos and roast for at least 5 more minutes.
evidence: Turn and char the jalapeños for at least 5 more minutes

conversation.text: I'm not sure if 5 minutes would be enough. Can you help me?
Have they blistered and turned black on all sides?
evidence: blister and blacken on all sides

conversation.text: Not yet.
Then they're not ready. You need to keep roasting and turning them until they blister and blacken on all sides.
evidence: keep roasting on the grill and turn them frequently

conversation.text: Okay. I think it's the time.
Are the jalapenos soft and charred?
Yes, they are.
Then you can place them on a plate with tongs. You can steam or peel them before eating.
evidence: use the long-handled tongs to transfer them from the grill to a plate
Finish the jalapeños by steaming and peeling them

recipe.title: How to Roast Jalapenos on the Grill

procedure.summary: Prepare a gas or charcoal grill.
procedure.description: Turn a gas grill on to medium-high. If you're using a charcoal grill, heat a chimney 1/2 to 3/4 full of briquettes until they're ashy and hot. Dump the hot coals onto the grate.

procedure.summary: Rinse any dirt off of the jalapeños.
procedure.description: Get out as many jalapeños as you'd like to roast. Rinse them with fresh water to remove any dirt or grit.

procedure.summary: Arrange the jalapeños on the hot grill.
procedure.description: Place the rinsed jalapeños on the hot grill so there's a little space (about 1 inch or 2/5 cm) between them. Put the lid on the grill.

procedure.summary: Roast the jalapeños on the grill for 5 minutes.
procedure.description: Keep the lid on the grill while the jalapenños roast.

procedure.summary: Turn and char the jalapeños for at least 5 more minutes.
procedure.description: Remove the lid from the grill and use long tongs to turn the jalapeños over. Let the jalapeños keep roasting on the grill and turn them frequently so they blister and blacken on all sides. This should take another 5 to 10 minutes.
Once the jalapeños are soft and charred, use the long-handled tongs to transfer them from the grill to a plate. Finish the jalapeños by steaming and peeling them.
